summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, providing the password for a drive containing discovery materials in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell. The document is a procedural communication regarding evidence handling.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for which discovery materials are being transmitted. She is the recipient of the discovery.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The author of the letter, sending the password for the discovery drive on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is part of the prosecution team handling the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Transmission of Discovery Password
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends the password for a drive containing discovery materials to the detention center where Ghislaine Maxwell is held.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a formal communication from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
It provides the password (1357924680) for a drive containing discovery materials for inmate Ghislaine Maxwell (ID 02879-509).
The letter indicates ongoing legal proceedings and evidence exchange in Maxwell's case as of August 2020.
Audrey Strauss was serving as Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York at this time.
The correspondence is addressed to the legal department of the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, where Maxwell was held.
